content:
mikedlr opened Issue #2725:

Thanks for filing an issue! Please fill out the TODOs below.

.clif Test Case

N.A. this is documentation

Steps to Reproduce

  • First: go to https://cranelift.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
  • Then: note lack of documentation
  • Then: note lack of link to new documentation location

Expected Results

https://cranelift.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ should contain either documentation or a link to where the documentation is now.

Actual Results

Welcome to Read the Docs

This is an autogenerated index file.

Please create an index.rst or README.rst file with your own content under the root (or /docs) directory in your repository.

Versions and Environment

Cranelift version or commit: 797d2e2b (version at bottom of page)

Operating system: Chromium? That count?

Architecture: Semi-Traditional English

Extra Info

All the best - thanks for doing FOSS software

bjorn3 commented on Issue #2725:

It probably broke with the merge of Cranelift into the Wasmtime repo. You can find most of the docs at https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/tree/main/cranelift/docs. The instruction docs can be found at https://docs.rs/cranelift-codegen/*/cranelift_codegen/ir/trait.InstBuilder.html.

bnjbvr commented on Issue #2725:

It would probably require access to the Readthedocs.io settings to configure a new repository where their CI would pull the code from, and put a small page

bnjbvr edited a comment on Issue #2725:

It would probably require access to the Readthedocs.io settings to configure a new repository where their CI would pull the code from, and put a small note that the docs have moved somewhere else. In addition to this (or alternatively), we could remove mentions to this URL so it's forgotten into oblivion.

@mikedlr do you recall where you saw this URL, by luck?

sunfishcode commented on Issue #2725:

As discussed on zulip, I've now removed the old readthedocs.io site, which we migrated off of in https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/issues/1160.

bnjbvr commented on Issue #2725:

Thanks Dan! Search engines should catch up in a couple days.
